sen.j: 三代格式（さんだいきゃくしき）とは平安時代に編纂された弘仁格式、貞観格式、延喜格式の三つの格式(きゃくしき、律令の補助法令)の総称である。
sen.e: Sandai-Kyaku-Shiki is a collective term for three Kyaku-Shiki Acts (Kyaku-Shiki: supplementary law to Ritsu-ryo), Konin-Kyaku-Shiki Act, Jogan-Kyaku-Shiki Act, and Engi-Kyaku-Shiki Act, which were codified in Heian era.

Sandai-Kyaku-Shiki is a term used to collectively refer to three Kyaku-Shiki acts (laws supplementary to the Ritsu-ryo, which were the statutes of the Nara and Heian periods) that were codified during the Heian era: the Konin-Kyaku-Shiki Act, the Jogan-Kyaku-Shiki Act and the Engi-Kyaku-Shiki Act.

sen.j: なお、弘仁・貞観_(日本)・延喜とは、それぞれの格式が編纂された年代の元号であるが、実際の完成には時間がかかっている。
sen.e: Although Konin, Jogan (era name in Japan), and Engi are eras during which periods the respective Kyaku-Shi Codes were codified, they were actually completed after the respective eras.
sen.cmt: 「（日本）は、中国の元号と区別するために記載されていると思いますが、「日本」だけを訳すと意味不明であると考えたので、日本における元号の名前という意味で訳しました。「実際の完成には時間がかかっている」は、それぞれの年代の元号の後に完成されたと考えてそのように訳しました。
sen.e: Although codification of the above acts began in the Konin, Jogan (Japan) and Engi eras, respectively, they were actually completed in later eras.

sen.j: 弘仁格式は嵯峨天皇が藤原冬嗣に、貞観格式は清和天皇が藤原氏宗に、延喜格式は醍醐天皇が藤原時平に、それぞれ命じて編纂させたものである。
sen.e: Konin-Kyaku-Shiki Act was codified by FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu by order of Saga Emperor, Jogan-Kyaku-Shiki Act was codified by FUJIWARA no Ujimune by order of Seiwa Emperor, and Engi-Kyaku-Shiki Act was codified by FUJIWARA no Tokihira by order of Daigo Emperor.

The Konin-Kyaku-Shiki Act was codified by Fujiwara no Fuyutsugu by order of Emperor Saga, the Jogan-Kyaku-Shiki Act was codified by Fujiwara no Ujimune by order of Emperor Seiwa, and the Engi-Kyaku-Shiki Act was codified by Fujiwara no Tokihira by order of Emperor Daigo.

The Konin-Kyaku-Shiki Act was codified by FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu by order of the Emperor Saga, the Jogan-Kyaku-Shiki Act was codified by FUJIWARA no Ujimune by order of the Emperor Seiwa and the Engi-Kyaku-Shiki Act was codified by FUJIWARA no Tokihira by order of Emperor Daigo.
